newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's BCH shares jump on talk of split.
newsitem.headline: Spain's BCH shares jump on talk of split.

text.p: Shares in Spanish bank Banco Central Hispano bucked the market downtrend and rose amid talk it would soon approve a share split, dealers said on Thursday.
"There's a rumour going around that the next directors' meeting will approve a stock split, and that's what's sending the shares higher," a trader at a foreign bank said.
BCH said in March it was considering a split, but a spokeswoman told Reuters Thursday that no decision had yet been taken. The next board meeting is set for next week.
"In March we said we would see how the share developed and think about it for next year," she said. "It can't be ruled out but it's still a little bit early."

She acknowledged, however, that the share had soared from some 3,800 to more than 6000 pesetas since the announcement BCH was considering a share split -- a move which has gained popularity in the Spanish market this year.
But a dealer at foreign brokerage who requested anonymity said this did not justify a gain in the shares.
"A split doesn't affect the valuation in the slightest, and at above 6,000 pesetas BCH is already overpriced. If they were thinking of a buyback then that would be something," he said.
At 1330 GMT, shares in the group rose 100 pesetas, or 1.64 percent, to 6,200, while the IBEX-35 index of shares fell 65.57 points, or 0.92 percent, to 7071.34.
